questions.text: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: 400mcg/day of folic acid tablet is administered to pregnant females with megaloblastic anemia.

options.label: B
options.text: Serum transferrin is first marker to reduce in Fe deficiency anemia.

options.label: C
options.text: 1mg/day of folic acid tablet is given to a pregnant female on valproate for the treatment of epilepsy.

options.label: D
options.text: Under the Anemia Mukt Bharat Program, a pregnant female should take iron and folic acid supplements for 180 days during pregnancy.

questions.correct_answer: D. Under the Anemia Mukt Bharat Program, a pregnant female should take iron and folic acid supplements for 180 days during pregnancy.
questions.explanation:
400mcg/day

1mg/day

4mg/day
  • All pregnant females to prevent neural tube defects (start 1 month before conception & continue for 3 months after delivery)
  • All pregnant females of AEDs which do not lead to neural tube defects (eg. Lamotrigine)
  • All diabetic pregnant females

 
  • All pregnant females with 2nd & 3rd degree relatives with neural tube defects
  • All pregnant females with megaloblastic anemia
  • All pregnant females on drugs that increase metabolism of folic acid (eg.: Trimethoprim, Sulphasalazine)
  • All pregnant females with h/o having/ delivering a baby with neural tube defects
  • All pregnant females on AEDs which cause neural tube defects (eg.: Valproate. Carbamazepine)
  • All pregnant females with Sickle Cell Anemia (5mg/day is preferred

questions.text: A 38 y/o G2P1L1 Rh -ve woman has a Rh +ve husband. Her first born is also Rh +ve. During her first pregnancy she got an amniocentesis done at 16 weeks to rule out the possibility of Down’s Syndrome, following which she tested positive for Indirect Coombs’ Test. What would be the next best step in the current pregnancy?

options.label: A
options.text: Check for Rh antibody titer every 4 weekly until 24 weeks and biweekly following that and make sure it remains <1:16

options.label: B
options.text: Advise for amniocentesis again to rule out Down’s Syndrome in current pregnancy

questions.correct_answer: A. Check for Rh antibody titer every 4 weekly until 24 weeks and biweekly following that and make sure it remains <1:16

questions.text: A G2P1L0A1 female is brought to the ER at period of gestation of 31 weeks with the chief complaint of lower abdominal pain. She says she has a h/o of previous preterm delivery, 2 years ago, at 20 weeks. Per abdomen examination: 4 contractions / 20 minutes On Examination: Cervical dilatation = 3 cm Fetal Heart Rate = 140 beats per minute What should be the next best step?

options.label: A
options.text: Terminate pregnancy immediately and deliver the baby

options.label: B
options.text: Administer progesterone and perform McDonald’s cervical cerclage because cervix has only dilated 3 cm.

options.label: C
options.text: Administer dexamethasone with nifedipine and deliver between 24 hours to 7 days after the 4 th dose of dexamethasone

options.label: D
options.text: Start i.v. broad spectrum antibiotics and skip corticosteroids because POG > 28 weeks

questions.correct_answer: C. Administer dexamethasone with nifedipine and deliver between 24 hours to 7 days after the 4 th dose of dexamethasone

questions.text: A primigravida comes to the antenatal clinic for her regular visit at 33 weeks. Currently, her BP is 140/90. Her BP during the visit previous week was 130/90. NST was done and it was reactive. She gives no h/o of blurring of vision, headache or epigastric pain. There is no significant finding in the blood tests or urine tests. What would be the next best step?

options.label: A
options.text: Administer dexamethasone and perform LSCS at 34 weeks

options.label: D
options.text: Start 100 mg oral Labetalol twice a day

questions.correct_answer: B. Wait till 37 weeks for delivery
